job: Hybrid Cloud- MSc and PhD Summer internship 2023- Research Lab
description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, let's talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to work with top cloud researchers? The Hybrid Cloud department at IBM Research is looking for an outstanding research intern with experience and interest in cloud computing and distributed systems. We have a number of openings in which you can be a part of a research team in the following areas:
Solving real-world problems for managing big data
Building the next generation of high performance and programmable networks for the multi-cloud era
Space isolation in the Linux kernel for secure cloud computing
Secure storage systems
Multi-cloud observability
Edge computing
Our summer internship program offer you an opportunity to join our research team for 3 months internship (working 5 days a week) in either Haifa, Tel Aviv or Beer Sheva sites (according to each internship). During the internship, you will be working with our talented researcher on top projects, helping create the next generation of AI, security, quantum, cloud and much more.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
MSC or PhD candidate from CS in advanced stages of studies, in distributed systems, data management, networking, computing architecture or related fields. Knowledge and preferably research experience in either: distributed computing, cloud environments, networking, optimization, operating systems, data stores.
Experience in programming languages (e.g., Go, Python, Rust, Java, C++)
Please add your grade sheet to your application.

Please add your grade sheet to your application.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Publication/s at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals
Experience with software development in a Linux and/or Kubernetes environment. Basic knowledge of cloud computing concepts (microservices, service discovery, distributed coordination, load balancers, block storage services etc.)

About Business Unit
With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems. Join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing, augmented intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain, to name a few.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
Are you ready to be an IBMer?
This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.
About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.


At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. job: AI Privacy - MSc and PhD Summer Internship 2023 - Research Lab
description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Join the Data Security and Privacy group in IBM Research - Haifa to contribute to cutting-edge technologies at the intersection between security/privacy and machine learning.

We are developing novel techniques for assessing the privacy risk of AI models via various attacks (such as membership and attribute inference attacks), creating privacy-preserving models (e.g., by applying differential privacy), as well as selective removal of specific samples from trained models (unlearning).
Join us to contribute to one of these fascinating and innovative areas, with the goal of publishing results in top conferences/journals and contributing to leading open-source projects in the area of Trustworthy AI. This is an opportunity to work on advanced research topics but bringing them into the context of real-world scenarios and use cases based on real customer pain-points.

Relevant Publication: https://www.research.ibm.com/haifa/ccoe/collaboration.shtml
Our summer internship program offer you an opportunity to join our research team for 3 months internship (working 5 days a week). During the internship, you will be working with our talented researcher on top projects, helping create the next generation of AI, security, quantum, cloud and much more.

MSc or PhD student in Computer Science at leading university
Good theoretical knowledge of ML/DL
Hands-on experience in python and ML/DL frameworks (e.g., pytorch)
Authorized to work in Israel or hold an applicable work permit required by the Israeli law
